ETYMOLOGY: From Late Latin improbabilis ('not likely to be true or happen'), from Latin in- ('not') + probabilis ('provable, credible, likely'). Probabilis is derived from probare ('to test, approve').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: An adjective is a word or phrase naming an attribute, added to or grammatically related to a noun to modify or describe it.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Not likely to be true or to happen.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 不大可能发生或真实的；未必会发生的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: It is highly improbable that the team will win the championship this year.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这支队伍今年赢得冠军的可能性非常小。
